name: Novotel Paris Les Halles

reviews.text: Our family with 2 teenage daughters stayed here just before Christmas and it was great. the location is fabulous as we caught the train in from CDG airport to Les Halles and then just a short walk if you find the right exit - Pont Neuf is good and turn left. We arrived around 8am so room was not ready so the helpful reception staff stored our bags and we had coffee in the lobby and went for a walk, coming back around 10.30am when our room was ready.
reviews.title: great value, location and service for family with teen girls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room 401 which was quite spacious consisting of a double bed for the adults, 1 pull-out double sofa (very thin mattress) and 2 pull out singles which had good quality mattress. Pillows are pretty average. Only small complaint was that the top shelf of the cupboard was a bit dusty which we found out when we threw our coats up there. We didnt have free wi-fi but used the lobby Apple Macs for internet access although they were quite often occupied.
reviews.title: Good hotel overall

reviews.text: Breakfasts were substantial and was included in our rate, strangely though the first morning was not included. When you have two teens who eat for free it really is great value. Front desk staff were always very helpful and happy to give advice and organise things like taxi. We had so much luggage that we decided to skip the metro to Orly and take a maxi-taxi for about 50 euros which was not much more than metro and a lot less hassle, especially in the snow.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was fabulous and there was only 1 street close by that felt a bit seedy at night. Big shopping mall just 2 mins walk, all the fast food restaurants you need, other restaurant options - Hippopotamous was good for a family and a supermarket just 5 mins walk - handy for buying snack lunches (in hotel room) and bottled water, which is much more economical than eating at restaurants all the time. Metro is right at the front door although you must make sure to ask concierge for the name of the exit which is Line 4 Rue de Lingerie as the Chatelet station is huge and gets confusing when you are underground.
reviews.title: The staff was excellent, the room was very good and loved the service!

reviews.text: The Marais district (Place des Voges), Louvre, Notre Dame, etc are all within 15 mins walk. Great hotel and highly recommend for an economical stay for a family of 4.
reviews.title: Large Rooms and a Very Central Location

reviews.text: I very regularly go to Paris for business and always stay at the Novotel. If you wish to see several clients a day and therefore prefer the métro, this is THE place for you. The busy Châtelet métro station is only a few steps from the hotel. Rooms are spacious, quiet and clean - it is true what another member said about the hot water (not always warm enough, especially in the morning). You must understand the Novotel system with the beds: There are no twin beds, only one (fairly wide) bed. But the sofa turns into a second bed if you are not used to sharing - do not hesitate to convert it into a bed, it is easy and ready for use. The only complaint I have about this hotel is the breakfast, but they do warn you in the lifts. Have it before 7.30 a.m. if possible - beyond this time, it is a real problem to get a table. Very friendly staff and nice bar with a good bar pianist. While some people may find the area a bit seedy, I like the huge shopping mall adjacent to the hotel and the large number of restaurants. A room easily sleeps four if you come with your kids, because of the extra bed mentioned above.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Unforgettable business trip! This is not a **** hotel.
reviews.title: Dirty and not recommendable

reviews.text: Room 122: Uncomfortable mattress, big rust spot in the bathtub, "cleaned" vomit (or something else) on the cheap carpet; fleas and perhaps various other "hungry" predators shared the room with me (back home, I had to visit 2 doctors to find out what attacked me and get rid of it). I have already warned the staff at the reception so that no one else would have to suffer. Photos attached.
The entrance is nice; the restaurant is OK but not great for breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice hotel; questionable location

reviews.text: A frequent traveler from Luxembourg.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay at the Novotel Les Halles

likes.liked: — Great location - right above a big metro and RER station, walk to the Lourve or Notre Dame

reviews.text: I traveled with my sister, 3 nights Paris. We certainly made the right choice on this hotel. Reasonably priced, most centrally located, spacious, clean rooms, friendly staff and an amazing breakfast. We were able to walk to most places we wanted to see and were able to rest comfortable every night. Great, great choice. Would recommend it any time.
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay in central Paris.

reviews.text: Location is very good - walking distance to Notre Dame, Louvre, right next to Chatlet metro station. Good restaurants - including quick takeout panini's & crepe's. Our favourite - outdoor food market on Thursdays on Rue Montmartre (behind St. Eustache Church) - pickup a baguette, ham/salami, chicken, cheese and wine for a very nice meal.
reviews.title: Great location, Spacious Rooms

reviews.text: Note - Chatlet / Les-Halles underground metro station is somewhat big and confusing.
reviews.title: Good location but just a typical big chain hotel

reviews.text: Located within walking distance of Notre Dame, Pompideau Centre and the Seine with Chatelet metro station (exit 10 I think) right outside the hotel entrance that links you to all other attractions easily. Breakfast is very busy after 9.00 at weekends and very ordinary for a 4star hotel. It is very plentiful, however with the usual selection of food although we were disappointed by the cold pancakes and bland scrambled egg. There are loads of cafes surrounding the hotel which I am sure would offer a cheaper, more authentic french breakfast.
reviews.title: Central and clean but nothing special

reviews.text: We had a 6th floor room which was an odd shape and had a sloped ceiling which restricted headroom - so mind your heads. Room was clean and comfortable. Good bag storage facilities are available after you have checked out and if you are continuing your sightseeing.
reviews.title: Magnifique, magnifique.

reviews.title: location location location ! nice room, friendly service

reviews.text: The room was nice, great view at les halles, nespresso water and free wifi that worked good.
reviews.title: Great hotel, new, modern. Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed many times at this hotel, mainly for its superb location, and have always been slightly unhappy about its aspect, the bed and the breakfast. All this has changed as a result of a recent refurbishment and I can now whole-heartedly recommend the place. It is also very good value for money, considering the steep prices charged by other four-star hotels in Paris.
reviews.title: Recently refurbished

description: The Novotel Paris Les Halles is a 4 star hotel in the centre of Paris with direct Metro and RER train connections to Charles de Gaulle and Orly airports, the major train stations, Disneyland Paris and major Paris attractions including the Pompidou Centre, the Louvre, Notre Dame and more. The hotel offers 285 rooms, nine meeting rooms for conferences and seminars. Ideal for a business trip or holiday in Paris, the hotel also features a bar, restaurant and a quiet patio to ensure you a pleasant stay.
